full_content: No comment is expected from Barack Obama Members of the #FYF911 or #FukYoFlag and #BlackLivesMatter movements called for the lynching and hanging of white people and cops. They encouraged others on a radio show Tuesday night to  turn the tide  and kill white people and cops to send a message about the killing of black people in America.One of the F***YoFlag organizers is called  Sunshine.  She has a radio blog show hosted from Texas called,  Sunshine s F***ing Opinion Radio Show. A snapshot of her #FYF911 @LOLatWhiteFear Twitter page at 9:53 p.m. shows that she was urging supporters to  Call now!! #fyf911 tonight we continue to dismantle the illusion of white Below is a SNAPSHOT Twitter Radio Call Invite   #FYF911The radio show aired at 10:00 p.m. eastern standard time.During the show, callers clearly call for  lynching  and  killing  of white people.A 2:39 minute clip from the radio show can be heard here. It was provided to Breitbart Texas by someone who would like to be referred to as  Hannibal.  He has already received death threats as a result of interrupting #FYF911 conference calls.An unidentified black man said  when those mother f**kers are by themselves, that s when when we should start f***ing them up. Like they do us, when a bunch of them ni**ers takin  one of us out, that s how we should roll up.  He said,  Cause we already roll up in gangs anyway. There should be six or seven black mother f**ckers, see that white person, and then lynch their ass. Let s turn the tables. They conspired that if  cops started losing people,  then  there will be a state of emergency. He speculated that one of two things would happen,  a big-ass [R s?????] war,  or  ni**ers, they are going to start backin  up. We are already getting killed out here so what the f**k we got to lose? Sunshine could be heard saying,  Yep, that s true. That s so f**king true. He said,  We need to turn the tables on them. Our kids are getting shot out here. Somebody needs to become a sacrifice on their side.He said,  Everybody ain t down for that s**t, or whatever, but like I say, everybody has a different position of war.  He continued,  Because they don t give a f**k anyway.  He said again,  We might as well utilized them for that s**t and turn the tables on these n**ers. He said, that way  we can start lookin  like we ain t havin  that many casualties, and there can be more causalities on their side instead of ours. They are out their killing black people, black lives don t matter, that s what those mother f**kers   so we got to make it matter to them. Find a mother f**ker that is alone. Snap his ass, and then f***in hang him from a damn tree. Take a picture of it and then send it to the mother f**kers. We  just need one example,  and  then people will start watchin .  This will turn the tables on s**t, he said. He said this will start  a trickle-down effect.  He said that when one white person is hung and then they are just  flat-hanging,  that will start the  trickle-down effect.  He continued,  Black people are good at starting trends. He said that was how  to get the upper-hand. Another black man spoke up saying they needed to kill  cops that are killing us. The first black male said,  That will be the best method right there. Breitbart Texas previously reported how Sunshine was upset when  racist white people  infiltrated and disrupted one of her conference calls. She subsequently released the phone number of one of the infiltrators. The veteran immediately started receiving threatening calls.One of the #F***YoFlag movement supporters allegedly told a veteran who infiltrated their publicly posted conference call,  We are going to rape and gut your pregnant wife, and your f***ing piece of sh*t unborn creature will be hung from a tree. Breitbart Texas previously encountered Sunshine at a Sandra Bland protest at the Waller County Jail in Texas, where she said all white people should be killed. She told journalists and photographers,  You see this nappy-ass hair on my head?   That means I am one of those more militant Negroes.  She said she was at the protest because  these redneck mother-f**kers murdered Sandra Bland because she had nappy hair like me. #FYF911 black radicals say they will be holding the  imperial powers  that are actually responsible for the terrorist attacks on September 11th accountable on that day, as reported by Breitbart Texas. There are several websites and Twitter handles for the movement. Palmetto Star  describes himself as one of the head organizers. He said in a YouTube video that supporters will be burning their symbols of  the illusion of their superiority,  their  false white supremacy,  like the American flag, the British flag, police uniforms, and Ku Klux Klan hoods.Sierra McGrone or  Nocturnus Libertus  posted,  you too can help a young Afrikan clean their a** with the rag of oppression.  She posted two photos, one that appears to be herself, and a photo of a black man, wiping their naked butts with the American flag.For entire story: Breitbart News LAW ENFORCEMENT ON HIGH ALERT Following Threats Against Cops And Whites On 9-11By #BlackLivesMatter And #FYF911 Terrorists [VIDEO]

gpt-4o-mini/shots-00(15.837):
{'content': 'No comment is anticipated from Barack Obama regarding recent statements made by members of the #FYF911, #FukYoFlag, and #BlackLivesMatter movements. During a radio show on Tuesday night, participants called for violence against white individuals and police, suggesting that such actions would send a powerful message about the killings of Black people in America.

One prominent organizer, known as Sunshine, hosts a radio blog called "Sunshine's F***ing Opinion Radio Show" from Texas. At 9:53 p.m., she urged her supporters via her Twitter account, @LOLatWhiteFear, to engage in the movement, stating, "Call now!! #FYF911 tonight we continue to dismantle the illusion of white supremacy." The show aired at 10:00 p.m. Eastern Time, where calls for lynching white people were made openly.

A 2:39-minute clip from the broadcast was provided to Breitbart Texas by an individual called Hannibal, who has faced death threats for interrupting #FYF911 conference calls. In the clip, one unidentified male speaker stated, "When those motherf***ers are by themselves, that’s when we should start f***ing them up." He suggested that Black people should respond in kind to violence against them, saying, "There should be six or seven Black people, see that white person, and then lynch their ass."

The speaker speculated that if police began to lose lives, it could lead to a state of emergency. "We are already getting killed out here, so what the f**k we got to lose?" he claimed, with Sunshine affirming his statements. The man continued, emphasizing the need to "turn the tables," insisting that someone needed to make a sacrifice for their cause, and comparing their situation to ongoing violence faced by the Black community.

Another supporter echoed the need to retaliate against police who kill Black individuals. He deemed this the most effective approach. Previously, Sunshine expressed anger towards racist individuals who disrupted one of her calls, subsequently sharing one of their phone numbers, which led to that person receiving threats.

Reports indicate that during one of these calls, a #F***YoFlag supporter threatened a veteran who had infiltrated the call, stating, "We are going to rape and gut your pregnant wife, and your f***ing piece of sh*t unborn creature will be hung from a tree." 

Earlier, at a protest for Sandra Bland, Sunshine had made inflammatory remarks, suggesting that all white people should be killed, while also expressing a personal grievance tied to her racial identity. The #FYF911 movement claims it will hold accountable those responsible for the September 11 attacks, with various websites and social media accounts promoting its agenda. 

Palmetto Star, another key organizer of the movement, stated in a YouTube video his intention for supporters to burn symbols of perceived white supremacy, including the American flag and KKK hoods. Meanwhile, Sierra McGrone, also known as Nocturnus Libertus, provocatively posted images illustrating the group's message. 

This situation has drawn significant attention, with law enforcement reportedly on high alert due to the threats directed at police and the white community surrounding these movements.', 'retries': 0}

{'content': 'In an alarming escalation of rhetoric, members from radical groups such as the #FYF911 and #FukYoFlag movements have called for violence against white people and police officers, claiming this is necessary to address racial disparities in America. A notable figure within these groups is Sunshine, a member of the #F***YoFlag movement who maintains a radio show under the pseudonym "Sunshine's F***ing Opinion." Her call-to-action reached out encouraging supporters on Twitter at 9:53 p.m. to "Call now!!" urging that tonight they continue to dismantle the illusion of white supremacy.

The #FYF911 movement, also known for its association with calls for violence following police-involved shootings, hosted a radio show at 10:00 p.m. eastern standard time. During the episode, listeners clearly expressed a desire for lynching and killing of white individuals as retaliation for racial killings in America. A recording from this show is available on Breitbart Texas' platform.

Two anonymous black men participated actively, advocating for violent retaliation. One called for targeting lone individuals out of frustration at the high rates of black deaths at the hands of police. Another suggested killing officers directly to take control over the situation. The anonymous speakers referenced past events involving Sandra Bland and other cases, emphasizing their belief that white authorities and racist groups were responsible for widespread racial violence.

In a previous incident, Sunshine had been disrupted by what she perceives as infiltrators from racist white supremacist groups. In response, one of these alleged infiltrators was sent the phone number of a member who subsequently received death threats.

At a Sandra Bland protest at the Waller County Jail in Texas, Sunshine made clear her militant stance on racial issues. Her comments attracted significant criticism and controversy. #FYF911 members have vowed to hold those responsible for terrorist attacks on September 11 accountable, linking these past tragedies with ongoing racial grievances.

The movement employs various platforms, including Palmetto Star and the #BlackLivesMatter hashtag, to spread their message. A controversial meme circulating among supporters showcases an individual wiping their buttocks with an American flag, illustrating the extreme nature of this rhetoric.

Amidst these threats, local authorities have increased their presence and preparation in anticipation of potential violence following these provocative statements, as a report titled “LAW ENFORCEMENT ON HIGH ALERT Following Threats Against Cops And Whites On 9-11” details. The recent developments serve as a stark reminder of the continued need for vigilance and careful examination of hate speech in contemporary society.', 'retries': 0}

{'content': 'Members of the #FYF911 and #BlackLivesMatter movements, including some from the #FukYoFlag movement, have made controversial calls for violence during a recent radio broadcast. The discussion centered around retaliatory acts against white individuals and law enforcement officers in response to perceived injustices faced by Black people in America.

During Tuesday night's program on "Sunshine’s F***ing Opinion Radio Show," hosted from Texas, an organizer named Sunshine urged supporters to dismantle the notion of white dominance through a movement described as #FYF911. The show live-streamed at 10:00 p.m. Eastern Standard Time.

In this broadcast, participants explicitly advocated for acts such as lynching and killing, with particular focus on making these events known publicly to affect change. A specific two-minute-and-forty-nine-second segment from the show highlighted these conversations and has been circulated through platforms like Breitbart Texas.

An unidentified caller described a retaliatory strategy: targeting lone individuals perceived as antagonists in order to "turn the tables" on those they view as oppressors. The rhetoric included calls for sacrificial acts against opponents, aiming to trigger a shift in public perception and reduce grievances within their community. This approach was said to be part of broader strategic thinking around creating a more significant impact.

Breitbart Texas previously reported that Sunshine had expressed anger over disruptions during her radio conferences by individuals she labeled as "racist white people." In response to infiltration, Sunshine exposed the phone number of one disruptor, leading to subsequent threats against this individual, who is a veteran. 

Sunshine and fellow advocates voiced similar sentiments at protests, like the one held for Sandra Bland outside Waller County Jail in Texas. During such events, provocative language was used to incite emotional responses.

The #FYF911 movement also plans actions on September 11th aimed at holding those they see as responsible for past injustices accountable. They describe planned demonstrations involving symbolic acts against symbols perceived as representing false power structures, including national flags and police uniforms. 

Law enforcement agencies have been placed on alert following these threats, emphasizing a tense atmosphere around potential violent encounters on or after September 11th.

The ongoing public discourse reflects complex and deeply charged societal tensions, with calls for drastic measures stirring considerable controversy and concern. For the full story, refer to Breitbart News’ detailed coverage titled "LAW ENFORCEMENT ON HIGH ALERT Following Threats Against Cops And Whites On 9-11 By #BlackLivesMatter And #FYF911 Terrorists [VIDEO]."', 'retries': 0}

deepseek-chat/shots-00(48.963):
{'content': '**Controversial Radio Show Sparks Outrage with Calls for Violence Against White People and Police**

Members of the #FYF911 (F***YoFlag) and #BlackLivesMatter movements have drawn widespread attention after a radio show aired on Tuesday night, during which participants called for the lynching and killing of white people and police officers. The show, hosted by a Texas-based organizer known as "Sunshine," featured inflammatory rhetoric aimed at retaliating against the systemic violence faced by Black Americans.

Sunshine, who hosts *Sunshine’s F***ing Opinion Radio Show*, used her platform to urge supporters to "dismantle the illusion of white [supremacy]." A snapshot of her Twitter page at 9:53 p.m. Eastern Standard Time (EST) showed her promoting the show with the hashtag #FYF911. The broadcast, which began at 10:00 p.m. EST, included explicit calls for violence. A 2-minute, 39-second clip of the show, provided to Breitbart Texas by an anonymous source referred to as "Hannibal," captured alarming statements from participants.

During the broadcast, an unidentified Black man advocated for targeting white individuals when they are alone, stating, "When those motherf***ers are by themselves, that’s when we should start f***ing them up." He suggested that Black individuals should "lynch their ass" and "turn the tables" on systemic violence. He speculated that if police officers began losing personnel, it would create a "state of emergency," potentially leading to a "big-ass war" or a shift in power dynamics. "We are already getting killed out here, so what the f*** do we have to lose?" he asked.

Sunshine echoed his sentiments, agreeing with his statements. The man further argued that such actions would create a "trickle-down effect," asserting that Black people are "good at starting trends." He emphasized the need for a symbolic act of violence, such as hanging a white person from a tree and photographing it, to send a message. "We just need one example," he said, "and then people will start watching."

Another participant called for targeting police officers, stating, "We need to kill cops that are killing us." The first speaker agreed, calling it "the best method." These remarks come amid heightened tensions between law enforcement and activist groups.

Breitbart Texas previously reported that Sunshine had expressed frustration when "racist white people" infiltrated one of her conference calls. In response, she released the phone number of one infiltrator, leading to threatening calls against the individual. In one instance, a supporter of the #F***YoFlag movement allegedly threatened a veteran who had infiltrated the call, saying, "We are going to rape and gut your pregnant wife, and your f***ing piece of sh*t unborn creature will be hung from a tree."

Sunshine has a history of making provocative statements. At a Sandra Bland protest in Waller County, Texas, she declared that all white people should be killed, telling journalists, "You see this nappy-ass hair on my head? That means I am one of those more militant Negroes." She claimed Bland was murdered because she had "nappy hair like me."

The #FYF911 movement has also targeted "imperial powers" they hold responsible for the September 11, 2001, terrorist attacks. Organizers, including one known as "Palmetto Star," have called for burning symbols of "false white supremacy," such as the American flag, British flag, police uniforms, and Ku Klux Klan hoods. Sierra McGrone, also known as "Nocturnus Libertus," posted images of individuals using the American flag in a degrading manner, accompanied by the caption, "You too can help a young Afrikan clean their a** with the rag of oppression."

The movement’s rhetoric has prompted law enforcement to remain on high alert, particularly as threats against police and white individuals coincide with the anniversary of 9/11. The controversy underscores the deepening divisions in American society and the volatile nature of online activism.

For the full story, visit Breitbart News.', 'retries': 0}
deepseek-reasoner/shots-00(59.695):
{'content': '**Radical Elements within #FYF911 and #BlackLivesMatter Movements Advocate Violence in Radio Broadcast**  

Members of the #FYF911 (F***YoFlag) movement, alongside some associated with #BlackLivesMatter, issued explicit calls for violence against white individuals and law enforcement during a radio show hosted Tuesday night. The broadcast, titled *Sunshine’s F***ing Opinion Radio Show* and aired at 10:00 p.m. EST, urged supporters to “turn the tide” by retaliating against the killings of Black Americans through targeted attacks.  

The show’s host, identified as “Sunshine,” a Texas-based organizer, promoted the event on her Twitter account (@LOLatWhiteFear) at 9:53 p.m., encouraging followers to join a discussion aimed at “dismantling the illusion of white [supremacy].” A 2:39-minute clip from the program, provided to Breitbart Texas by a source using the pseudonym “Hannibal,” captured multiple callers advocating the lynching and killing of white people and police officers. Hannibal claims to have faced death threats after infiltrating #FYF911 conference calls.  

During the broadcast, an unidentified Black male speaker argued for organized retaliation: “When [white people] are alone, that’s when we should start f***ing them up… Lynch their ass. Let’s turn the tables.” He suggested that targeting law enforcement or civilians could provoke a “state of emergency,” leading to either a “big-ass war” or concessions from opponents. Sunshine endorsed his remarks, stating, “Yep, that’s true. That’s so f***ing true.” The speaker further asserted that graphic acts, such as hanging individuals from trees and disseminating images, would create a “trickle-down effect” to shift power dynamics.  

Another caller emphasized focusing on police: “We need to kill cops that are killing us,” to which the first speaker agreed, calling it “the best method.” These statements align with prior reports by Breitbart Texas detailing Sunshine’s history of incendiary rhetoric. At a 2015 Sandra Bland protest in Waller County, Texas, she declared, “All white people should be killed,” attributing Bland’s death to racial animus.  

The movement’s tactics have previously included doxxing perceived adversaries. After a veteran infiltrated an #FYF911 call, Sunshine allegedly leaked his contact information, resulting in threats against him and his family, including a message vowing to “rape and gut your pregnant wife” and hang their unborn child.  

#FYF911 organizers, including “Palmetto Star,” announced plans to burn symbols of “white supremacy” on September 11th, such as the American flag, police uniforms, and KKK hoods, to challenge “imperial powers” they blame for historical oppression. Activist Sierra McGrone, alias “Nocturnus Libertus,” posted images of individuals using the American flag to wipe their bodies, captioned as rejecting the “rag of oppression.”  

Law enforcement agencies are reportedly on high alert following these threats. Breitbart Texas continues to monitor the situation as tensions escalate ahead of the planned 9/11 demonstrations.  

*Note: Explicit language has been partially censored to adhere to professional tone guidelines. Direct quotes remain intact to preserve factual accuracy.*', 'reasoning_content': 'Okay, I need to rewrite this text to improve clarity, readability, and engagement while keeping all original details and factual accuracy. There's a mention of past incidents where Sunshine doxxed someone, leading to threats. Also, the group plans to burn symbols like flags on 9/11, and there are websites and social media accounts involved. Breitbart reported on law enforcement being on alert.

I need to ensure the structure is logical. Maybe start with the main event (the radio show), then detail the participants, the content, the source of the clip, past incidents, and the planned actions on 9/11. Keep the tone neutral and professional, suitable for a news report. Avoid redundancy but include all key details. Use concise sentences and smooth transitions.

Check for any jargon or unclear phrases. For example, "turn the tide" is in quotes, so it's okay. The explicit quotes need to be handled carefully to maintain professionalism but still convey the severity. Maybe use partial censorship like "f***ing" instead of the full word. Ensure all names, hashtags, and movements are correctly mentioned. Verify the timeline: radio show at 10 PM EST, Twitter snapshot at 9:53 PM. Include the threat to the veteran and the previous protest where Sunshine spoke. Mention the symbols they plan to burn and the associated social media accounts. Conclude with law enforcement's response.

Need to vary sentence structure to keep it engaging. Use active voice where possible. Make sure each paragraph transitions smoothly to the next. Check that all quotes are accurately represented without altering their meaning. Ensure the final statement about law enforcement being on high alert is included. qwen2.5:14b_8k/shots-00(29.389):
{'content': 'Barack Obama has not commented on the recent calls for violence by members of the #FYF911 and #FukYoFlag movements, as well as some individuals associated with Black Lives Matter. On a radio show Tuesday night, these groups urged listeners to "turn the tide" by lynching and killing white people and police officers, citing racial injustices in America.

One organizer, Sunshine, hosts a Texas-based radio blog called "Sunshine's F***ing Opinion Radio Show." A screenshot from her Twitter page @LOLatWhiteFear shows she was urging supporters during the show to "Call now!! #fyf911 tonight we continue to dismantle the illusion of white."

At 10:00 PM EST, the radio show invited listeners to join a call. A snippet from it reveals explicit calls for violence and retribution. An unidentified male caller suggested that if black people suffer violent deaths at the hands of others, then they should exact similar punishment on whites and police: "When those motherf**kers are by themselves, that’s when we should start f***ing them up."

Sunshine concurred, expressing approval for these sentiments: "Yep, that's true. That's so f***king true." Other callers echoed the theme of violence, discussing how killing white people would shift the narrative and create a "trickle-down effect" to initiate change.

Another caller focused on police officers who target black individuals: “We need to start taking out these cops first because they are part of it.” He believed if enough casualties were inflicted upon law enforcement or whites in general, an emergency state might be declared, leading to a significant shift in national dynamics.
